item.title: [Near 100%] Ancient Curses - All Curses, All Effects
item.dc:creator: @Owner_Fritz Owner Fritz
item.description:
@Owner_Fritz wrote:

[quote=“Pure Slay, post:32, topic:404892”][quote author=Owner Fritz link=topic=501899.msg3672977#msg3672977 date=1311053449]

“whatever shit the OP thought this was”, “amazingly wrong”?

I’d love to hear your reasoning behind that.

kthxbai
[/quote][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=501899.msg3672981#msg3672981 date=1311053684]

“whatever shit the OP thought this was”, “amazingly wrong”?

I’d love to hear your reasoning behind that.

kthxbai

Sure,

You are using pointless methods, wasting space, and hard coding.

Ever heard of enums? look into them, they are handy with repetitive systems such as prayer.

Your whole ‘code’ can be rewritten to prob less then 100 lines, maybe even less. I’d say around 50-80 if someone was dedicated enough to show you how much space you wasted.

Also, just an ego suggestion. Don’t act like a hot shot and dumb ass when people tell you your contribution isn’t very good. They are telling you that you need to improve. So don’t go blowing smoke when someone with more experience trys to tell you that you need to step it up.

Enums can’t be modified/created on runtime so I dislike them and refuse to use.

Pointless methods. No, I organize it by splitting it into methods so I can read my own code.

Wasting space. /cares Space doesn’t determine how well it works.

Hard coding. Lold, this isn’t client work. Everything done server sided is ‘hard’ coding.

“More experienced”? Just because I don’t ever release shit on Mopar doesn’t mean I’m less experienced than your average Mopar troll. Lold.

And finally @haters, if you think my code is shit, does it do anything to tell me that? (Especially when it isn’t) At least I’m releasing something to the community and not just being obnoxious trolls. If you kids are so damn amazing release a better system.

I got up to there and then realized the rest was also trash.

Sure,

You are using pointless methods, wasting space, and hard coding.

Ever heard of enums? look into them, they are handy with repetitive systems such as prayer.

Your whole ‘code’ can be rewritten to prob less then 100 lines, maybe even less. I’d say around 50-80 if someone was dedicated enough to show you how much space you wasted.

Also, just an ego suggestion. Don’t act like a hot shot and dumb ass when people tell you your contribution isn’t very good. They are telling you that you need to improve. So don’t go blowing smoke when someone with more experience trys to tell you that you need to step it up.

Enums can’t be modified/created on runtime so I dislike them and refuse to use.

Pointless methods. No, I organize it by splitting it into methods so I can read my own code.

Wasting space. /cares Space doesn’t determine how well it works.

Hard coding. Lold, this isn’t client work. Everything done server sided is ‘hard’ coding.

“More experienced”? Just because I don’t ever release shit on Mopar doesn’t mean I’m less experienced than your average Mopar troll. Lold.
[/quote]

No, don’t kid yourself. You just don’t know how to use them and write an effective system.

If you are better then me, then let’s do some refractoring? Show me the 657 sendSkills packet in less then 5 mins. That’s more then enough time to do it.

GO GO GO.[/quote]

Why the fuck would I know or want to know anything about any 500+ client/server? I don’t like getting my hands covered in shit.

[quote=“sinisoul, post:33, topic:404892”][quote author=Owner Fritz link=topic=501899.msg3672977#msg3672977 date=1311053449]

“whatever shit the OP thought this was”, “amazingly wrong”?

I’d love to hear your reasoning behind that.

kthxbai

Sure,

You are using pointless methods, wasting space, and hard coding.

Ever heard of enums? look into them, they are handy with repetitive systems such as prayer.

Your whole ‘code’ can be rewritten to prob less then 100 lines, maybe even less. I’d say around 50-80 if someone was dedicated enough to show you how much space you wasted.

Also, just an ego suggestion. Don’t act like a hot shot and dumb ass when people tell you your contribution isn’t very good. They are telling you that you need to improve. So don’t go blowing smoke when someone with more experience trys to tell you that you need to step it up.

Enums can’t be modified/created on runtime so I dislike them and refuse to use.

Pointless methods. No, I organize it by splitting it into methods so I can read my own code.

Wasting space. /cares Space doesn’t determine how well it works.

Hard coding. Lold, this isn’t client work. Everything done server sided is ‘hard’ coding.

“More experienced”? Just because I don’t ever release shit on Mopar doesn’t mean I’m less experienced than your average Mopar troll. Lold.

And finally @haters, if you think my code is shit, does it do anything to tell me that? (Especially when it isn’t) At least I’m releasing something to the community and not just being obnoxious trolls. If you kids are so damn amazing release a better system.
[/quote]

I got up to there and then realized the rest was also trash.[/quote]

It’s true, glad to see you know java.

Stupid trolls, instead of trolling me, write a better system and show me up. That would shut me up more than this idiotic act of yours.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Pure_Slay Pure Slay
item.description:
@Pure_Slay wrote:

Faded Vision:

Go back to R’Locus nub, no need for poorly constructed undocumented code here.

That’s mildly harsh as some RL members are actually intelligent enough to write a proper system instead of whatever shit the OP thought this was. (Ex: Mwah, Sinisoul, Bl00d, Sigma_, Trey, Steve, ect)

If your ancient curses alone are over 200-300 lines. Then you are doing something wrong, or doing something amazingly accurate. In this case, amazingly wrong.

Good job on contributing, but next time come up with a cleaner system.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Owner_Fritz Owner Fritz
item.description:
@Owner_Fritz wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I, post:5, topic:404982”][quote author=Owner Fritz link=topic=501899.msg3672694#msg3672694 date=1311039128]

It’s still useless crap? I don’t see why idiots hardcode so much shit.

Lol? I just raped your ass and now you try to change the subject.

But this is a good thing, it opens another opportunity to show your idiocity.

Hardcoding curses? Are you stupid? This is server sided. Hardcoding is clients. Lold
[/quote]If you have it in the server, I infer you would have it in the client. Right? Thus, it’s hardcoded shit. You want curses, use a higher revision/protocol.

No, you didn’t rape me, because you’re a fucking idiot.

Also, this shit has been released here enough, we don’t need more. Thus, lock requested.[/quote]

I see one other release. And that was incomplete.

I also see many other faggots at mopar, therefore by your own reasoning mopar obviously don’t need you.

item.description:
@Owner_Fritz wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I, post:3, topic:404982”][quote author=Owner Fritz link=topic=501899.msg3672568#msg3672568 date=1311032676]
Poorly coded? That’s a good one lol.

Mopar + Coding = /fp
[/quote]

if(o.curses().curseActivated[7]) { // Deflect Magic o.curses().curseProjectileEvent(7, damage); damage = (int)damage * 60 / 100; }what the fuck is the purpose of using damage as an argument, then changing its value?[/quote]

Because the curse’s reflected damage is modified differently than the base damage. Lold irl.

item.title: [Near 100%] Ancient Curses - All Curses, All Effects
item.dc:creator: @Shadowspkin Shadowspkin
item.description:
@Shadowspkin wrote:

[quote=“Owner Fritz, post:10, topic:404892”]Poorly coded? That’s a good one lol.

Mopar + Coding = /fp[/quote]

About 70% of that is true, And it won’t be poorly coded mostly because Vain doesn’t do PI anymore. Anyways im not saying your bad or anything I have seen your work before and its actually nice but you can’t just talk down on everyone thinking your the best “You mad cause you couldn’t add it to your server” <–Something close to that, Anyways Moparscape + coding= /fp (70%), Mainly cause were a teaching community so most people here do fail. And just because we say something bad about a TuT doesn’t mean we couldn’t add it, Most people make replys in a TuT never do. We just talk about what you posted.
